downloadDescription: SenseLearner is a minimally-supervised all-words word sense disambiguation system. More details, including publications and software download, are available from the SenseLearnerProject webpage. Both versions 2.0 and 1.0 (beta), as well as a demo, are available. Changes in version 2.0: a client-server model that allows for significantly faster tagging; simpler input file format (the SemCor-like format is not anymore required).

Sense tagged data for 288 nouns, created within the Open Mind Word Expert framework during one year of activity.

Sense tagged data for nouns, verbs, adjectives, created within the Open Mind Word Expert framework. These data sets were used during the Senseval-3 evaluations. This download includes data for 39 ambiguous words in Romanian, 57 ambiguous words in English (annotated with WordNet/Wordsmyth senses), and 41 English words annotated with their corresponding Hindi translation.
Sense tagged data for six words with two-way ambiguities (bass, crane, motion, palm, plant, tank).
Word aligned data for Romanian-English and English-French, parallel texts for training, and code for word alignment evaluation is available from the HLT/NAACL 2003 workshop page.
Texts semantically annotated with WordNet 1.6 senses (created at Princeton University), and automatically mapped to WordNet 1.7 and WordNet 1.7.1.

Evaluation software for text filtering systems, implements the normalized utility, F-measure, precision, and recall, as defined in the TREC 2002 Filtering task. Straightforward usage, follows closely the TREC 2002 Filtering guidelines.
Wikify identifies keywords in documents and turns them into Wikipedia-style links.
GeoLIWC visualizes geographical distributions of LIWC categories in the United States.
